intro: Blakwellia dentata, commonly known as the toothed blakwellia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Blakwellia dentata is typically found in heathlands and dry forests, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
